programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet one of the NCAAs most tenacious teams: the Boston University Terriers. The Division I hockey program is one of the best for a reason, churning out top-level talent season after season.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: In these real-life stories of the illicit drug trade, learn how law enforcement beats the smugglers in their high-stakes game of cat and mouse.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Sean investigates the mystery of the lake.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief Jeff Dengate, presents inspiring runner stories from around the country. Meet runners from Colorado, New Jersey, Kentucky and Pennsylvania who are making a difference.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: When body parts wash ashore in the Gulf Coast over several days in 2012, investigators must identify the victim before they can find the killers. Even then, justice is elusive.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: In this battle, it's a clash of comfort food. Chef Pom Moongauklang of Pom Poms Sandwicheria & Tea House in The Milk District takes on Chef Nikki Akins of Nikkis Place in the Parramore District. Its Catfish versus Mackerel on Blind Kitchen.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: These criminals may not have blood on their hands, but they still leave despair in their wake. From shady non-profits to fraudulent contractors, to wide-spread postal theft, here are some of the most devastating white-collar crimes to be attempted across the country.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A passionate beekeeper in Omaha, and a Pittsburgh based seasoned mosaic artist.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: More than money makes the crime world go round. You wont believe the odd array of goods that have been stolen over the years -- and the motivations behind the thefts.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Lacee is a driven, successful professor who's ready to put down her books and pick up her love life. Who will get top marks for her affection?

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they wont give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey and natural wine.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day learn that in Homestead, looks can be deceiving. The guys throw axes in a bank, zip line in a church, and end the day with a beer at Duke's.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Meet a pair of dueling Creole dishes when Chef Eric Cook of Gris Gris battles it out against Chef Ericka Michelle Lassair of Diva Dawg. Will Chef Divas signature sauce stump her worthy opponent, or will Cookie manage to pull a rabbit out of a chefs hat?

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: This is gonna be a hot one. Chefs Ryan Grace and Roger Li are getting spicy in todays Spice It Up challenge. Will our chefs bring the heat? Or will the competition be too hot to handle?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A young boy and his family's housekeeper are brutally killed in an upscale Omaha neighborhood. Their case goes cold for years, until another double homicide reveals the link and unmasks a serial killer.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The brutal murders of two trans women of color just 48 hours apart in New Orleans unsettle the community, leaving many wondering if the cases are connected. Detectives uncover clues, yet justice remains elusive.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Love is all around us when you take the time to look. Whether its a couple still falling in love, or a community organizer making sure every child has a birthday party, there are heartwarming stories all across this country.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A duo pulls a Bonnie and Clyde in a truck stolen from a dealership, and a pair takes money from a monastery. These shocking stories of couples in crime have to be witnessed to be believed.

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Three jewelry makers in Greenville are about to take on some heavy metal as they go head-to-head to design and build an arm cuff inspired by the Liberty Bridge. Will their designs be too arm-twisting for the judges?

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A Boston jeweler with a unique medium, and kitty spaceships in Pittsburgh.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Yesinia Melo of Jessys Clean Meals in Lawrence takes on Chef Jason Gentles of Sahel in Lowell in a spicy battle of the mill towns. Can Yesinias fresh cooking put the Jerk champion in his place? Or will Jason knock it out of the park?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: If its pleasure you seek, youll find it here. Delight in sipping luxurious wines or crave elevated dining experiences? Satisfy your urges in this alluring town. Well take you on a thrilling ride and bring you to fields that glow.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day make gnocci and join in on a Hearts of Steel rowing team practice along the Allegheny River before ending the day at Grist House Craft Brewery in Millvale.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel joins baseball legend, Ryan Ripken, for a home run day, exploring the best of Baltimore. They bat 100 at Ripken Stadium, learn about sea life at the National Aquarium, crush indoor rock climbing and show down in an epic cook-off.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: USA boxing champion and CEO of Milwaukee LSS Hector Colon brings Greg to meet locals who are championing their city. Greg steps in the boxing ring with Hector, learns the history of Milwaukee-style pizza, and experiences the growing Puerto Rican culture.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Skip the drive-through! Chefs Ericka Loyal and Josh Vecchiolla are finessing their favorite classic fast food dishes. Which chef's spin will win the judges over?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms cant take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Two serial killers whose chilling crimes left their communities devastated.

programme.title: Only In
programme.desc: Where can you find young entrepreneurs, a nonprofit tune-up shop keeping the community safe and a distillery serving up the spirit of Central Pennsylvania? The same place where genius is grown and savory ice cream is a tradition.

programme.title: WGAL Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest local news and weather from WGAL.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
programme.desc: A stranger than fiction documentary that chronicles a semi-scripted extreme sporting league that premiered in 2000. Socker Slam took elements of wrestling, rugby and butts up shenanigans and body slammed them into a soccer drama.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into the Midwest's sweets. From the messy madness of puppy chow to kolaches to the infamous buckeye, enjoy the delicious confections that make the region a haven for dessert lovers.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Chris has an unstoppable spirit, despite the challenges of Down syndrome. His resilience has propelled him to extraordinary achievements, including clinching the gold in Greece. Meaghan takes him on a whirlwind of experiences tailored just for him.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: From Colorado to Maryland, correspondent Jessica Gomez takes Matter of Fact viewers across the U.S. to talk with Americans about what keeps them up at night and what keeps them going.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Chronicle: Bring Them Home
programme.desc: (2017) Taken from their reservations, thousands of Native American children underwent an education experiment at the Carlisle Indian Industrial School. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro documents the Northern Arapaho's historic attempt to reclaim loved ones.

programme.title: Lowrider Legacy
programme.desc: Lowrider Legacy follows celebrated lowrider families, scholars, and activists and documents the history of resistance on wheels that has defined lowrider culture.
